title: Body Systems Assessments Schema
description:
Create Comprehensive Medical Body System Assessment Schemas

Design and implement standardized data schemas for recording clinical assessments across five major body systems: cardiac, endocrine, hematological, integumentary, and respiratory.

Requirements:
- Define structured schema for each of the five body systems
- Include relevant clinical data fields for each system:
  - Cardiac: heart rate, rhythm, sounds, murmurs, peripheral pulses, edema
  - Endocrine: hormone levels, gland function, metabolism indicators
  - Hematological: blood counts, clotting factors, anemia indicators
  - Integumentary: skin color, texture, lesions, wounds, temperature
  - Respiratory: breath sounds, respiratory rate, oxygen saturation, lung capacity
- Ensure schemas support both normal findings and abnormal observations
- Include fields for clinical notes and timestamps
- Validate that data types are appropriate for medical measurements
- Consider standardized medical terminology and coding systems
- Support versioning for schema updates over time
- Ensure compatibility with common medical record formats

Deliverables:
- Schema definitions for all five body systems
- Documentation of field definitions and valid value ranges
- Example data instances for each schema
